data.chText: 高兴；愉快；快乐
data.enText: a feeling of great pleasure

data.chText: 十分高兴的心情
data.enText: a feeling of sheer/pure delight

data.chText: 孩子们看到小狗时高兴得大声尖叫。
data.enText: The children squealed with delight when they saw the puppy.

data.chText: 这场比赛她赢得很轻松，令所有的崇拜者大为高兴。
data.enText: She won the game easily, to the delight of all her fans.

data.chText: 他以证实别人出错为（一大）快事。
data.enText: He takes (great) delight in (= enjoys) proving others wrong.

data.chText: 令人高兴的事；乐事；乐趣
data.enText: something that gives you great pleasure

data.chText: 这吉他弹起来很惬意。
data.enText: This guitar is a delight to play.

data.chText: 生活在乡村的乐趣
data.enText: the delights of living in the country

data.chText: 使高兴；使愉快；使快乐
data.enText: to give sb a lot of pleasure and enjoyment

data.chText: 这消息将使全世界崇拜他的人都感到高兴。
data.enText: This news will delight his fans all over the world.
delight in sth/doing sth

data.chText: 以…为乐（尤指做使别人感到尴尬、不舒服的事）
data.enText: to enjoy doing sth very much, especially sth that makes other people feel embarrassed, uncomfortable, etc.

data.chText: 以上各词均指令人愉快、高兴的事。
data.enText: These are all words for things that make you happy or bring you enjoyment.
pleasure

data.chText: 指乐事、快事：
data.enText: a thing that brings you enjoyment or satisfaction

data.chText: 日常生活的苦与乐
data.enText: the pleasures and pains of everyday life

data.chText: 很高兴认识您。
data.enText: It's been a pleasure meeting you.
delight

data.chText: 指令人高兴的事或人、乐事、乐趣：
data.enText: a thing or person that brings you great enjoyment or satisfaction

data.chText: 生活在乡村的乐趣
data.enText: the delights of living in the country
joy

data.chText: 指令人高兴的事或人、乐事、乐趣：
data.enText: a thing or person that brings you great enjoyment or happiness

data.chText: 童年的欢乐与悲伤
data.enText: the joys and sorrows of childhood

data.chText: 用pleasure、delight还是joy？
delight或joy语气较pleasure强。令人高兴的人，尤其是孩子，可用delight或joy，但不能用pleasure。joys常与sorrows形成对比，但delights无这种对比。
data.enText: A delight or joy is stronger than a pleasure ; a person, especially a child, can be a delight or joy , but not a pleasure ; joys are often contrasted with sorrows , but delights are not.
pleasure, delight or joy?
treat

data.chText: 指乐事、乐趣：
data.enText: ( informal ) a thing that sb enjoyed or is likely to enjoy very much

data.chText: 你以前从来没有到过这一地区？那么你一定会喜之不尽。
data.enText: You've never been to this area before? Then you're in for a real treat .
the pleasures/delights/joys of sth
It's a pleasure/delight/joy/treat to see/find…
It was a great pleasure/delight/joy to me that…
Some of their football was a pleasure/delight/joy to behold/watch .
Their baby girl was a delight/joy.
a real/rare pleasure/delight/joy/treat

ex.chText: 孩子们曾从捉迷藏游戏中得到过很多快乐。
ex.enText: The children used to get a lot of pleasure out of the hide-and-seek game.

ex.chText: 金庸的作品给武侠小说迷们带来了极大的乐趣。
ex.enText: Jin Yong's works have given great pleasure to fans of kung fu novels.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指某种事物带来的愉悦感或满足感。

ex.chText: 那孩子欢呼着跑向父母。
ex.enText: That child ran towards his parents with a cry of delight.

ex.chText: 让她高兴的是，她男朋友刚好在圣诞节之前回来了。
ex.enText: To her delight, her boyfriend came back right before Christmas.

synonyms.bx: 指某事物或某人带来的欣喜、愉悦之感，语气强于 pleasure。

ex.chText: 唱歌给她带来了极大的快乐。
ex.enText: Singing has brought her enormous enjoyment.

ex.chText: 不要让他们破坏我们的兴致。
ex.enText: Don't let them spoil our enjoyment.

synonyms.bx: 指客观事物给人带来的乐趣，语气较轻。

ex.chText: 她收到了赴宴的邀请，这让她又惊又喜。
ex.enText: To her surprise and joy, she received an invitation to that party.

ex.chText: 得知这一消息之后，他们高兴得跳了起来。
ex.enText: On hearing the news, they jumped for joy.

synonyms.bx: 指比较强烈的欢乐情绪，语气弱于 rapture 而强于 pleasure。

ex.chText: 孩子们抬起头，欣喜若狂地看着她。
ex.enText: The kids gazed up at her in rapture.

ex.chText: 他们会对英格兰的胜利感到欣喜若狂。
ex.enText: They will be in raptures over England's victory.

synonyms.bx: 语气最强，指欢天喜地、欣喜若狂。

data.enText: delight in sth/doing sth

data.chText: 以…为乐（尤指做使别人感到尴尬、不舒服的事）
data.enText: to enjoy doing sth very much, especially sth that makes other people feel embarrassed, uncomfortable, etc.

tr: something or someone that provides a source of happiness
example: the new car is a delight

tr: a feeling of extreme pleasure or satisfaction
example: his delight to see her was obvious to all

tr: give pleasure to or be pleasing to

value.def: Delight is a feeling of very great pleasure.

example.ex: Throughout the house, the views are a constant source of surprise and delight...
example.tran: 从房子各处看到的景色不断给人以惊奇和欣喜。

example.ex: Andrew roared with delight when he heard Rachel's nickname for the baby...
example.tran: 安德鲁听到雷切尔给婴儿起的绰号时，不禁高兴得大笑起来。

example.ex: To my great delight, it worked perfectly.
example.tran: 让我非常高兴的是，它的效果奇佳。

value.def: If someone takes delight or takes a delight in something, they get a lot of pleasure from it.

example.ex: Haig took obvious delight in proving his critics wrong...
example.tran: 黑格显然以证明他的批评者是错误的为乐。

example.ex: I enjoy seeing your parents take such a delight in the boys.
example.tran: 看到你父母如此喜欢这些男孩子，我很高兴。

value.def: You can refer to someone or something that gives you great pleasure or enjoyment as a delight .

example.ex: The aircraft was a delight to fly...
example.tran: 驾驶这架飞机是一件乐事。

example.ex: Sampling the local cuisine is one of the delights of a holiday abroad.
example.tran: 品尝当地菜肴是去国外度假的一大享受。

value.tran: 令人高兴的人(或物);乐事;乐趣

value.def: If something delights you, it gives you a lot of pleasure.

example.ex: She has created a style of music that has delighted audiences all over the world...
example.tran: 她创造出了一种能令全世界的听众都感到快乐的音乐风格。
这份报告让环境保护主义者欢欣不已。

value.def: If you delight in something, you get a lot of pleasure from it.

example.ex: Generations of adults and children have delighted in the story...
example.tran: 一代又一代的成年人和儿童都很喜欢这个故事。

example.ex: He delighted in sharing his love of birds with children.
example.tran: 他喜欢与孩子们分享他对鸟类的热爱。

trans: 土耳其软糖，拌砂软糖(一种外粘白糖面的胶质糖果)
